title.text: An Improved Heuristic for Ellipsis Processing*

introductionContent.text: Robust response to ellipsis (fragmentary sentences) is essential to acceptable natural language interfaces.
For instance, an experiment with the REL English query system showed 10% elliptical input.
This only applies to inputs of the same type, e.g., repeated questions.
Allen (1979) deals with some examples of expansion ellipsis, by fitting a parsed elliptical input into a model of the speaker's plan.
This is similar to other methods that interpret fragments by placing them into prepared fields in frames or case slots (.
This approach seems most applicable to limiteddomain systems.
